question: Which of the following is the BEST preventive control to protect the confidentiality of data on a corporate smartphone in the event it is lost?
options: Biometric authentication for the device
Remote data wipe program
Encryption of the data stored on the device
Password for device authentication
correct: Encryption of the data stored on the device

question: Which of the following is MOST useful for determining whether the goals of IT are aligned with the organization's goals?
options: Key performance indicators (KPIs)
Balanced scorecard
Enterprise architecture (EA)
Enterprise dashboard
correct: Enterprise architecture (EA)

question: Capacity management tools are PRIMARILY used to ensure that
options: computer systems are used to their maximum capacity most of the time
concurrent use by a large number of users is enabled
available resources are used efficiently and effectively
proposed hardware acquisitions meet capacity requirements
correct: available resources are used efficiently and effectively

question: Which of the following cloud capabilities BEST enables an organization to meet unexpectedly high service demand?
options: Scalability
Flexibility
Alternate routing
High availability
correct: Scalability

question: An IS auditor is reviewing an artificial intelligence (Al) and expert system application The system has produced several critical errors with severe impact Which of the following should the IS auditor do NEXT to understand the cause of the errors?
options: Understand the purpose and functionality of the system.
Verify system adherence to corporate policy.

correct: Understand the purpose and functionality of the system.

question: During the course of fieldwork, an internal IS auditor observes a critical vulnerability within a newly deployed application What is the auditor's BEST course of action?
options: Report the finding to the external auditors
Identify other potential vulnerabilities
Notify IT management
Document the finding in the report
correct: Identify other potential vulnerabilities

question: What should be the PRIMARY focus during a review of a business process improvement project?
options: The cost of new controls
Business project plan
Continuous monitoring: plans
Business impact
correct: Business impact

question: Which of the following would be MOST important to include in an IS audit report?
options: Specific technology solutions for each audit observation
Observations not reported as findings due to inadequate evidence
The roadmap for addressing the various risk areas
The level of unmitigated risk along with business impact
correct: The level of unmitigated risk along with business impact

question: Which of the following is the MOST important factor when an organization is developing information security policies and procedures?
options: Compliance with relevant regulations
Consultation with security staff
Inclusion of mission and objectives
Alignment with an information security framework
correct: Alignment with an information security framework

question: Which of the following should be the GREATEST concern to an IS auditor reviewing the information security framework of an organization.
options: A list of critical information assets was not included in the information security policy

question: Which of the following would be MOST time and cost efficient when performing a control self-assessment (CSA) for an organization with a large number of widely dispersed employees?

Engaging external consultants
Top-down and bottom-up analysis

question: An audit identified weak password controls in a database system Which of the following provides the BEST evidence that the audit finding has been remediated?

question: To ensure adequate security and controls in e-commerce applications which of the following manages the certificate life cycle of public key pairs?

Certification practice statement (CPS)
Certification revocation list (CRL)
Certification authority (CA)
correct: Certification authority (CA)

question: Which of the following is the BEST data integrity check?
options: Tracing data back to the point of origin
Preparing and running test data
Performing a sequence check
Counting the transactions processed per day
correct: Tracing data back to the point of origin

question: Which of the following BEST indicates that an incident management process is effective?

options: The organization's network
The Internet

question: An organization has decided to purchase a web-based email service from a third-party vendor and eliminate its own email server infrastructure. What type of cloud computing environment would BEST meet the organization s objective?

Database as a Service (DBaaS)
Platform as a Service (PaaS)
Infrastructure as a Service (laaS)

User acceptance testing (UAT)

system interdependencies

mean time to restore (MTTR)

question: An organization is shifting to a remote workforce, in preparation, the IT department is performing stress and capacity testing of remote access infrastructure and systems. What type of control is being implemented?

Detective
Directive
Preventive

options: provide more flexibility
reduce the time to review code

replace all manual test processes

options: Inform audit management
Reevaluate internal controls.

question: Which of the following components of a service level agreement (SLA) provides the GREATEST assurance that service provider production issues will be resolved promptly.

question: When developing customer-facing IT applications, in which stage of the system development life cycle (SDLC) is it MOST beneficial to consider data privacy principles

question: An IT governance body wants to determine whether IT service delivery is based on consistently effective processes. Which of the following is the BEST approach?
options: Develop a maturity model

Evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs)
Implement a control self-assessment (CSA)
correct: Evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs)

options: Review equipment specifications

correct: Test selected controls.

options: Implementer
Approver

Reviewer

question: During which process is regression testing MOST commonly used?

question: Of the following, who is accountable for ensuring the representation of major stakeholders involved in a project?
options: Change control board
Steering committee
Project manager
Project management office (PMO)

options: number of new vulnerabilities reported
comparison with critical incidents experienced by competitors

question: __ is the PRIMARY reason to adopt a risk-based IS audit strategy?

and controls for the organization

Homogeneity of the network

IT manager

business process owners
business needs
vulnerabilities

Bluetooth

question: An IT asset management review finds that routers and switches are not sanitized before disposal. What is the GREATEST concern with this situation?
options: Configuration files may be extracted from the devices and compromise a network's security.
Confidential data files may be extracted from the devices and result in a privacy breach.
Staff are not following the organization's sanitization policies and procedures.
Sanitization is not part of the IT department\x92s security awareness training program.
correct: Confidential data files may be extracted from the devices and result in a privacy breach.

question: Which of the following practices is MOST helpful in preventing new incidents from occurring as a result of a recent patch installation?
options: Risk analyses are performed to justify the installation of security patches.
Security patches are tested prior to installation on the organization's equipment.
Tools are used to assess patch updates prior to installation of security patches.
Security patches require senior management approval prior to installation.
correct: Security patches are tested prior to installation on the organization's equipment.

question: An IS auditor performs an audit of physical access controls in an organization that uses RFID access cards at entrances. Which of the following findings poses the GREATEST risk?
options: Card readers are not connected to a centralized authorization server.
Access cards for one-day guests do not display the holder's photo.
Card readers do not have a backup battery to cope with power outages.
Security is not alerted after three failed access attempts.
correct: Card readers are not connected to a centralized authorization server.

question: Which of the following should be the PRIMARY consideration when establishing audit objectives?
options: Industry best practices
Assessment of prior audits
Organizational risk
Audit risk
correct: Organizational risk

question: Which of the following user actions poses the GREATEST risk for inadvertently introducing malware into a local network?
options: Downloading a file from an enterprise file share
Opening an email attachment from an external account
Viewing a hypertext markup language (HTML) document
Uploading a file onto an internal server
correct: Opening an email attachment from an external account

question: Which of the following fire suppression methods is MOST effective for use in a data center?
options: Inert gases
Dry chemical compounds
Dry-pipe water sprinkler system
Wet-pipe water sprinkler system
correct: Dry-pipe water sprinkler system

question: An IS auditor finds that a new network connection allows communication between the Internet and the internal enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. Which of the following is the PRIMARY business impact to include when presenting this observation to management?
options: An increase to the threat landscape
A decrease in data quality in the ERP system
An increase in potential fines from regulators
A decrease in network performance
correct: An increase to the threat landscape

question: An IS auditor recommends that the most recent patches be applied to all virtualized devices. Management objects because it does not consider the recommendation feasible. Which of the following is the auditors BEST course of action?
options: Insist that management create an action plan to address this risk.
Conduct a cost-benefit analysis to determine the feasibility.
Work with management to determine an acceptable alternative action plan.
Perform additional analysis to demonstrate the actual impact of missing patches.
correct: Work with management to determine an acceptable alternative action plan.

question: Which of the following findings related to segregation of duties should be of GREATEST concern to an IS auditor?
options: The person who edits source code also has write access to production.
The person who creates new user accounts also modifies user access levels.
The person who administers servers is also part of the infrastructure management team.
The person who tests source code also approves changes.
correct: The person who edits source code also has write access to production.

question: An IS auditor noted that management authorized the implementation of patches on IT infrastructure components without evaluation. The auditor's GREATEST concern should be that the patches were not evaluated for:
options: compliance with release management.
alignment with the data reference model.
impact on operational costs.
impact on the current IT environment.
correct: impact on the current IT environment.

question: Which of the following should be the PRIMARY purpose of conducting tabletop exercises when reviewing a security incident response plan?
options: To gather documentation for responding to security audit inquiries
To provide efficiencies for alignment with incident response test scenarios
To confirm that technology is in place to support the incident response plan
To determine process improvement options for the incident response plan
correct: To determine process improvement options for the incident response plan

question: Data centers that want to prevent unauthorized personnel from entering during a power outage should ensure external access doors:
options: are alarmed and monitored.
operate in fail-safe mode.
operate in fail-secure mode.
have physical key backup.
correct: operate in fail-secure mode.

question: At the conclusion of an IS audit, senior management decides to accept the risk of not correcting one of the reported issues. In the auditor's opinion, this results in a level of residual risk that is inappropriate for the organization. Which of the following is the BEST course of action?
options: Remove the disputed issue from the audit report.
Discuss the matter with the chief risk officer (CRO).
Discuss the matter with IS audit management and the chief audit executive (CAE).
Note in the audit report that management accepts the risk and take no further action.
correct: Discuss the matter with IS audit management and the chief audit executive (CAE).

question: Which of the following is an IS auditor's MOST important course of action to determine whether an organization's response to an incident was appropriate?
options: Inspect the reporting sent to senior management following the incident.
Review lessons learned to determine if correct actions have been taken
Assess whether the organization contained the incident in a timely manner
Assess whether the organization prioritized the incident based on policy.
correct: Assess whether the organization prioritized the incident based on policy.

question: As part of control self-assessment (CSA) activities in the finance department, an IS auditor identified that some of the controls were not tested and documented properly. Which of the following should the auditor do NEXT?
options: Perform additional testing to complement CSA activities in the finance department.
Expand the scope of the next internal audit planned for the finance department.
Issue an audit report to the finance manager regarding the inadequate testing of controls.
Provide guidance regarding control objectives to staff involved in the CSA.
correct: Provide guidance regarding control objectives to staff involved in the CSA.

question: Which of the following is an IS audit requirement when evaluating assertions made by management?
options: To ensure all risks have been addressed
To verify alignment with strategic goals
To assess whether the assertions comply with the law
To form conclusions about each assertion
correct: To form conclusions about each assertion

question: An audit has identified that business units have purchased cloud-based applications without IT's support. What is the GREATEST risk associated with this situation?
options: The application purchases did not follow procurement policy.
The application operating costs are not optimized
The applications could be modified without advanced notice
The applications may not reasonably protect data
correct: The applications may not reasonably protect data

question: Who is accountable for an organization's enterprise risk management (ERM) program?
options: Chief risk officer (CRO)
Steering committee
Executive management
Board of directors
correct: Board of directors

question: Due to limited resources, two of an organization's developers also support production maintenance and change implementation. Which of the following is the IS auditor's BEST recommendation to address segregation of duties conflicts?
options: Hire additional staff.
Accept the risk
Outsource change implementation.
Implement a change monitoring process.
correct: Implement a change monitoring process.

question: Which of the following is the BEST approach to minimize the risk of devices being unavailable following a required firmware upgrade?
options: Deploy incrementally from a staging environment.
Manually deploy to each device.
Automatically deploy to all devices directly from the manufacturer.
Roll into a mass distribution deployment.
correct: Deploy incrementally from a staging environment.

question: An IS auditor finds that an online retailer is experiencing unacceptable system response times due to high demand. Which of the following would BEST help to improve system performance?
options: Establishing disk mirroring
Optimizing data replication
Implementing load balancing
Changing firewall configuration
correct: Implementing load balancing

question: An employee approaches an IS auditor and expresses concern about a critical security issue in a newly installed application. Which of the following should the auditor do FIRST?
options: Discuss the concern with audit management.
Disclose the concern to legal counsel.
Conduct a review of the application.
Recommend reverting to the previous application.
correct: Conduct a review of the application.

question: For which of the following is the documentation of workaround processes critical to keeping business functions operational during recovery of IT systems?
options: Threat and risk assessment
Incident management process
Business continuity plan (BCP)
Business impact analysis (BIA)
correct: Incident management process

question: What should be an IS auditor's MOST important consideration when assessing whether an organization's IT project portfolio is appropriately prioritized?
options: Business impact analysis (BIA)
Cost-benefit analysis results
The organization\x92s business plan
The organization's IT budget
correct: The organizations business plan

question: Which of the following is MOST important for an organization to include in a software escrow agreement when outsourcing software development to a third party?
options: The escrow agent repository is to be securely protected against vendor access.
The escrow agent repository is to be subject to periodic audits by the organization.
The escrow agent repository is to be held in the organization's own country.
The escrow agent repository is to be updated as the software product evolves.
correct: The escrow agent repository is to be updated as the software product evolves.

question: Which of the following is the PRIMARY advantage of using an automated security log monitoring tool instead of conducting a manual review to monitor the use of privileged access?
options: Reduced costs associated with automating the review
Increased likelihood of detecting suspicious activity
Ease of storing and maintaining log file
Ease of log retrieval for audit purposes
correct: Increased likelihood of detecting suspicious activity

question: Which component of a business case provides the BEST indication that due diligence was performed during the vendor selection process?
options: Problem statement
Cost-benefit analysis
Alternative solutions
Management approval
correct: Alternative solutions

question: An IS auditor determines elevated administrator accounts for servers that are not properly checked out and then back in after each use. Which of the following is the MOST appropriate sampling technique to determine the scope of the problem?
options: Statistical sampling
Haphazard sampling
Random sampling
Stratified sampling
correct: Statistical sampling

question: Which of the following is the BEST recommendation to drive accountability for achieving the desired outcomes specified in a benefits realization plan for an IT project?
options: Ensure that the project manager has formal authority for managing the benefits realization plan.
Assign responsibilities
measures
and timelines for each identified benefit within the plan.
Document the dependencies between the project and other projects within the same program.
Ensure that IT takes ownership for the delivery and tracking of all aspects of the benefits realization plan.
correct: Assign responsibilities, measures, and timelines for each identified benefit within the plan.

question: Which of the following can increase the risk of data loss if data is corrupted or sabotaged?
options: Unsecured backups
Onsite backup storage
Replication for backups
Virtual backups
correct: Unsecured backups

question: Which of the following is MOST important for an IS auditor to verify when conducting a review of a potential third-party service provider?
options: Whether a business impact analysis (BIA) has been completed
Whether service level agreements (SLAs) are in place
Whether required security controls have been established
Whether a strategy for the use of third-party providers is established
correct: Whether required security controls have been established

question: A network analyst is monitoring the network after hours and detects activity that appears to be a brute-force attempt to compromise a critical server. After reviewing the alerts to ensure their accuracy, what should be done NEXT?
options: Isolate the affected system.
Perform a root cause analysis.
Document all steps taken in a written report.
Invoke the incident response plan
correct: Invoke the incident response plan

question: Which of the following observations should be of GREATEST concern to an IS auditor assessing access controls for the accounts payable module of a ^finance system?
options: Accounts payable staff have access to update vendor bank account details.
Payment files are stored on a shared drive in a writable format prior to processing.
Configured delegation limits do not align to the organization\x92s delegations policy.
The IS auditor was granted access to create purchase orders.
correct: Accounts payable staff have access to update vendor bank account details.

question: Emergency change control procedures MUST include which of the following requirements?
options: Update production source libraries to reflect changes.
Ensure audit logs track emergency changes.
Request that the help desk make the changes.
Use an emergency ID to move production programs into development.
correct: Update production source libraries to reflect changes.

question: The PRIMARY role of an IS auditor in the remediation of problems found during an audit engagement is to:
options: present updated policies to management for approval.
take ownership of the problems and oversee remediation efforts.
explain the findings and provide general advice.
help auditee management by providing the solution.
correct: explain the findings and provide general advice.

question: What would be an IS auditor's GREATEST concern when conducting an internal audit of a project to implement a customer relationship management (CRM) system?
options: Additional budget required for project implementation
Lack of stakeholder agreement on business requirements
Lack of a post-implementation review
Extended project scope beyond the design phase
correct: Lack of stakeholder agreement on business requirements

question: Which of the following is the BEST way to ensure a vendor complies with system security requirements?
options: Review past audits on the vendor's security compliance.
Review past incidents reported by the vendor.
Require a compliance clause in the vendor contract.
Require security training for vendor staff.
correct: Require a compliance clause in the vendor contract.

question: Which of the following should be the FIRST step for an IS audit manager who has been assigned to conduct a quality review on an audit that they supervised?
options: Alert external auditors of the situation
Notify senior audit leadership about the situation.
Determine whether audit evidence supports audit conclusions.
Discuss with the audit team to understand how conclusions were reached
correct: Determine whether audit evidence supports audit conclusions.

question: Management has decided to accept a risk in response to a draft audit recommendation. Which of the following should be the IS auditor's NEXT course of action?
options: Document management's acceptance in the audit report
Ensure a follow-up audit is on next year\x92s plan
Escalate acceptance to the audit committee.
Perform additional test procedures.
correct: Document management's acceptance in the audit report

question: An IS auditor is reviewing a project that involves creating a secure mobile app for claims processing. As part of a security-in-development model for the program,threat modeling should begin during which project phase?
options: Requirements definition
Testing
Architectural review
Coding
correct: Requirements definition

question: Which of the following is MOST important to consider when assessing the scope of privacy concerns for an IT project?
options: Data ownership
End-user access rights
Applicable laws and regulations
Business requirements and data flows
correct: Applicable laws and regulations

question: Which of the following would be of GREATEST concern to an |S auditor evaluating an organization's change management process?
options: A list of authorized requestors for emergency changes does not exist.
Change management meeting minutes are not available for several meetings.
Change requests are not subject to prioritization.
Changes are approved after being moved to production.
correct: Changes are approved after being moved to production.

question: An IS auditor has been asked to review the quality of data in a general ledger system. Which of the following would provide the auditor with the MOST meaningful results?
options: Discussion of the largest account values with business owners
Integrity checks against source documentation
Interviews with system owners and operators
System vulnerability assessment
correct: Integrity checks against source documentation

question: Which of the following should be of GREATEST concern to an IS auditor when assessing the effectiveness of project risk management processes?
options: The risk register is reviewed on a monthly basis.
Some risks in the risk register were found to be rated incorrectly.
The risk register is not maintained under version control.
Risk owners have not been identified in the risk register.
correct: Risk owners have not been identified in the risk register.

question: During an audit of a mortgage processing application, an |S auditor identifies that the application allows all users to export large quantities of sensitive customer data. Which of the following is the BEST control for the auditor to recommend to mitigate this risk?
options: Restrict download capability to authorized users.
Mask sensitive data within the application.
Require strong passwords for application login.
Periodically recertify user access.
correct: Periodically recertify user access.

question: During a follow-up audit, an IS auditor learns that management has deferred the implementation of a previously agreed-upon recommendation. What is the responsibility of the auditor?
options: Assess the impact of any risks the decision may pose to the organization.
Obtain commitment from management to implement the recommendations.
Report the decision to defer the implementation to the steering committee.
Amend the final report to reflect the decision to defer the implementation.
correct: Assess the impact of any risks the decision may pose to the organization.

question: An IS auditor finds an emergency change request where an IT manager approved the change, modified the code on the production platform, and resolved the ticket. Which of the following should be the auditor's GREATEST concern?
options: The IT manager performed the change.
The change did not go through the change advisory board.
There was no follow-up approval from the business.
There was no user acceptance testing (UAT) prior to making the change.
correct: There was no follow-up approval from the business.

question: An IS auditor is tasked with reviewing an organization's purchase invoices to discover fictitious entries that may have been created as part of a suspected fraud scheme. Which of the following is the MOST effective data analysis technique for this situation?
options: Benford's law
Data mining
Regression analysis
Predictive analysis
correct: Predictive analysis

question: Which of the following reliably associates users with their public keys and includes attributes that uniquely identify the users?
options: Digital certificate
Nonrepudiation
Encryption
Multi-factor authentication (MFA)
correct: Digital certificate

question: Which of the following would an IS auditor find to be the GREATEST risk associated with the server room in a remote office location?
options: The server room's location is known by people who work in the area.
The server room does not have biometric controls.
The server room does not have temperature controls.
The server room is secured by a key lock instead of an electronic lock.
correct: The server room does not have temperature controls.

question: Which of the following BEST enables an IS auditor to determine the effectiveness of controls for an audit area?
options: SWOT analysis
Control self-assessment (CSA)
Prior audit results
Control implementation methods
correct: Control implementation methods

question: The implementation of an IT governance framework requires that the board of directors of an organization:
options: approves the IT strategy.
addresses technical IT issues.
has an IT strategy committee.
approves all IT initiatives.
correct: has an IT strategy committee.

question: What is the PRIMARY reason an IS auditor would recommend an automated management review process for network administration activity on a daily basis instead of quarterly?
options: To detect network intrusions
To identify system changes
To identify failed login attempts
To detect unauthorized transactions
correct: To detect unauthorized transactions

question: At the end of each business day. a business-critical application generates a report of financial transactions greater than a certain value, and an employee then checks these transactions for errors. What type of control is in place?
options: Detective
Preventive
Deterrent
Corrective
correct: Detective

question: An organization has implemented a policy to require minimum security control baselines when configuring servers or systems. What control type has been implemented? '
options: Preventive
Directive
Compensating
Corrective
correct: Directive

question: To ensure the effectiveness of project risk management, when should the project risk register be reviewed and updated?
options: During the planning phase of the project
At the end of each phase of the project
Throughout the lifetime of the project
During the design phase of the project
correct: Throughout the lifetime of the project

question: Which of the following is an effective way to ensure the integrity of file transfers in a peer-to-peer (P2P) computing environment?
options: Associate a message authentication code with each file transferred
Encrypt the packets shared between peers within the environment
Connect the client computers in the environment to a jump server
Ensure the files are transferred through an intrusion detection system (IDS)
correct: Associate a message authentication code with each file transferred

question: Which of the following is the GREATEST impact as a result of the ongoing deterioration of a detective control?
options: Decreased effectiveness of root cause analysis
Decreased overall recovery time
Increased number of false negatives in security logs
Increased demand for storage space for logs
correct: Increased number of false negatives in security logs

question: Which of the following controls BEST mitigates the risk associated with password compromise?
options: Passwords are unique for each application
Passwords have format restrictions.
Passwords are stored in the cloud.
Passwords are masked
correct: Passwords are unique for each application

question: During preparation for an IS audit of an organization's IT security processes, which of the following documents would BEST enable the IS auditor to understand the ownership of specific operational tasks?
options: Documentation of non-functional requirements
Security risk register
RACI chart
IT service delivery procedures
correct: RACI chart

question: Which of the following findings is the GREATEST concern when reviewing a disaster recovery plan (DRP) with high availability requirements?
options: Responsibilities are not defined for the recovery team.
Annual tabletop testing is not required.
Vendor contact information is not reviewed.
Recovery time objectives (RTOs) are not defined.
correct: Recovery time objectives (RTOs) are not defined.

question: Which of the following BEST indicates a need to review an organization s information security policy?
options: Increasing complexity of business transactions
Increasing exceptions approved by management
High number of low-risk findings in the audit report
Completion of annual IT risk assessment
correct: Increasing exceptions approved by management

question: The waterfall life cycle model of software development is BEST suited for which of the following situations?
options: The project will involve the use of new technology.
The project is subject to time pressures
The project requirements are well understood
The project intends to apply an object-oriented design approach
correct: The project requirements are well understood

question: When evaluating the design of controls related to network monitoring, which of the following is MOST important for an is auditor to review?
options: Network topology diagrams
The ISP service level agreement (SLA)
Incident monitoring logs
Reports of network traffic analysis
correct: Network topology diagrams

question: While reviewing the effectiveness of an incident response program, an IS auditor notices a high number of reported incidents involving malware originating from removable media found by employees. Which of the following is the MOST appropriate recommendation to management?
options: Install an additional antivirus program to increase protection.
Ensure the antivirus program contains up-to-date signature files for all company devices.
Implement an organization-wide removable media policy.
Restrict access to removable media ports on company devices.
correct: Implement an organization-wide removable media policy.

question: An auditee has not implemented an internal IS auditor's recommended remediation actions, citing cost and capacity constraints. Which of the following would be the BEST course of action for the auditor?
options: Work with the auditee to develop a mitigation plan.
Invite an independent third party to review the recommendations.
Provide industry documentation supporting the recommendations.
Escalate to the audit committee.
correct: Work with the auditee to develop a mitigation plan.

question: An IS auditor is reviewing documentation from a change that was applied to an application. Which of the following findings would be the GREATEST concern?
options: Testing documentation is kept in hard copy format.
Testing documentation does not show manager approval.
Testing documentation is approved prior to completion of user acceptance testing (UAT).
Testing documentation is dated three weeks before the system implementation date.
correct: Testing documentation is approved prior to completion of user acceptance testing (UAT).

question: Which of the following would BEST reduce the operational risks associated with the potential for a third-party software vendor to go out of business?
options: Vendor software support agreements
Evidence of the vendor's financial stability
Software escrow agreements
Service level agreements (SLAs) in the contract
correct: Software escrow agreements

question: An IS auditor observes that an organization's IT service desk is closing tickets before problems are fully resolved, causing them to be reopened and impacting service levels. Which of the following is the BEST recommendation to address this situation?
options: Develop training on service desk ticket management.
Review the accuracy of date and time stamps on tickets.
Ensure updates to tickets are traceable to service desk staff
Extend the mean time to resolve problem tickets.
correct: Ensure updates to tickets are traceable to service desk staff

question: An organization has both an IT strategy committee and an IT steering committee When reviewing the minutes of the IT steering committee an IS auditor would expect to find that the committee
options: acquired and assigned appropriate resources for projects
assessed the contribution of IT to the business
compared the risk and return of IT investments
reviewed the achievement of the strategic IT objective
correct: acquired and assigned appropriate resources for projects

question: The PRIMARY purpose for establishing checkpoints in information processing systems is to provide for:
options: periodic balancing of processing results during system execution.
monitoring system performance against preestablished specifications
restart of processing after system failure without having to start from the beginning.
reentry of corrected transactions rejected in previous processing phases.
correct: restart of processing after system failure without having to start from the beginning.

question: Which of the following is an analytical review procedure for a payroll system?
options: Performing reasonableness tests by multiplying the number of employees by the average wage rate
Testing hours reported on time sheets
Performing penetration attempts on the payroll system
Evaluating the performance of the payroll system using benchmarking software
correct: Performing reasonableness tests by multiplying the number of employees by the average wage rate

question: A security review focused on data loss prevention (DLP) revealed the organization has no visibility to data stored in the cloud. What is the IS auditor's BEST recommendation to address this issue?
options: Utilize a DLP tool on desktops to monitor user activities.
Enhance the firewall at the network perimeter
Implement a file system scanner to discover data stared in the cloud
Employ a cloud access security broker (CASB).
correct: Employ a cloud access security broker (CASB).

question: Which of the following is MOST important when implementing a data classification program?
options: Formalizing data ownership
Planning for secure storage capacity
Developing a privacy policy
Understanding the data classification levels
correct: Formalizing data ownership

question: An organization is planning an acquisition and has engaged an IS auditor to evaluate the IT governance framework of the target company. Which of the following would be MOST helpful in determining the effectiveness of the framework?
options: Recent third-party IS audit reports
Current and previous internal IS audit reports
Self-assessment reports of IT capability and maturity
IT performance benchmarking reports with competitors
correct: Recent third-party IS audit reports

question: Which of the following should be the GREATEST concern to an IS auditor reviewing an organization s job scheduling practices?
options: Job processing procedures are missing
Jobs are executed during working hours,
Job dependencies are undefined
Most jobs are run manually
correct: Job dependencies are undefined

question: An IS auditor finds that the cost of developing an application is now projected to significantly exceed the budget Which of the following is the GREATEST risk to communicate to senior management?
options: Increased staff turnover
Project abandonment
Inability to achieve expected benefits
Noncompliance with project methodology
correct: Inability to achieve expected benefits

question: Which of the following is the BEST way to determine the effectiveness of an organization s current patch management system?
options: Perform a vulnerability assessment
Perform secure code review
Perform a network scan
Perform penetration testing
correct: Perform a vulnerability assessment

question: An organization has engaged a third party to implement an application to perform business-critical calculations Which of the following is the MOST important process to help ensure the application provides accurate calculations?
options: Quality assurance (QA)
Key performance indicator (KPl) monitoring
Change management
Configuration management
correct: Change management

question: The purpose of a checksum on an amount Field in an electronic data interchange (EDI) communication of financial transactions is to ensure
options: Authorization.
Integrity
Non-repudiation
Authenticity
correct: Integrity

question: An IS auditor reviewing the system development life cycle (SDLC) finds there is no requirement for business cases Which of the following should be of GREATEST concern to the organization?
options: Business resources have not been optimally assigned.
Business impacts of projects are not adequately analyzed
Vendor selection criteria are not sufficiently evaluated
Project costs exceed established budgets.
correct: Business impacts of projects are not adequately analyzed

question: Management has requested a post-implementation review of a newly Implemented purchasing package to determine the extent that business requirements are being met. Which of the following is MOST likely to be assessed?
options: Results of live processing
Acceptance testing results
Implementation methodology
Purchasing guidelines and policies
correct: Results of live processing

question: Following an application update, an IS auditor has identified performance degradation potentially resulting from a code defect. What type of testing is the BEST way to help prevent this issue in the future'?
options: Regression testing
Capacity testing
Resiliency testing
Performance testing
correct: Regression testing

question: Which of the following is acceptable to be left out of a final audit report?
options: Findings of minimal risk to the overall organization
The cause and risk associated with a reported issue
The nature and extent of audit procedures conducted
Significant findings previously communicated to management
correct: Findings of minimal risk to the overall organization

question: Which of the following is MOST helpful to a project manager in mitigating risk associated with frequent changes in project requirements
options: Performing mid-term project reviews
Monitoring changes in risk factors
Implementing formal reviews of changes
Conducting post-implementation reviews
correct: Implementing formal reviews of changes

question: Which of the following constitutes an effective detective control in a distributed processing environment-?
options: A log of privileged account use is reviewed
User IDs are suspended after three incorrect passwords have been entered
Users are required to request additional access via an electronic mail system
A disaster recovery plan (DRP) is in place for the entire system
correct: A log of privileged account use is reviewed

question: When an intrusion into an organizations network is detected, which of the following should be done FIRST?
options: Notify senior management
Block all compromised network nodes
Identify nodes that have been compromised
Contact law enforcement
correct: Identify nodes that have been compromised

question: Which of the following management decisions presents the GREATEST risk associated with data leakage?
options: There is no requirement for desktops to be encrypted
Staff are allowed to work remotely
Security policies have not been updated in the past year
Security awareness training is not provided to staff
correct: Security awareness training is not provided to staff

question: In order to be useful a key performance indicator (KPI) MUST
options: be measurable in percentages
be changed frequently to reflect organizational strategy
be approved by management
have a target value
correct: have a target value

question: A senior IS auditor suspects that a PC may have been used to perpetrate fraud in a finance department. The auditor should FIRST report this suspicion to:
options: the police.
auditee line management
the audit committee.
audit management.
correct: audit management.

question: Which of the following is the MOST important objective of a vendor selection review?
options: To ensure the vendor's security policies have been audited
To ensure the vendor proposal fulfills the business requirements
To ensure the vendor's data center is located in the same legal jurisdiction
To ensure the vendor source code library will be provided
correct: To ensure the vendor proposal fulfills the business requirements

question: An IS auditor finds that communication closets requiring electronic swipe card access are missing access logs. Which of the following should be done NEXT?
options: Determine whether any access swipe cards have been lost or stolen.
Determine whether anything is missing from the closets.
Determine whether management approved the access policy.
Determine whether there are video cameras covering the entrances.
correct: Determine whether there are video cameras covering the entrances.

question: Which of the following provides the BEST estimate of the complexity associated with a software development project for a web-based application?
options: Function point analysis
Lines of code
Value adjustment factor
Constructive cost model
correct: Function point analysis

question: During a pre-implementation review, an IS auditor notes that some scenarios have not been tested. Management has indicated that the project is critical and cannot be postponed. Which of the following is the auditor's BEST course of action?
options: Help management complete remaining scenario testing before implementation.
Determine whether the tested scenarios covered the most significant project risks.
Perform remaining scenario testing in the production environment post implementation.
Recommend project implementation be postponed until all scenarios have been tested.
correct: Determine whether the tested scenarios covered the most significant project risks.

question: Which of the following should be done FIRST when creating a data protection program?
options: Deploy intrusion detection systems (IDS).
Implement data loss prevention (DLP) controls.
Perform classification based on standards.
Test logical access controls for effectiveness.
correct: Perform classification based on standards.

question: A risk assessment has been completed.
